alert.note: Alert for Ida (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 7:30PM CDT until April 19 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN IDA COUNTY... At 729 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles north of Denison, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 722 PM Emergency Management reported 2.75 inch hail in Charter Oak. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Ida County. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
